meanings.definition: Inclined or likely to do or be affected by something
meanings.sent1: She was predisposed to enjoy the movie because it was a comedy.
meanings.sent2: He is predisposed to getting sunburned easily due to his fair skin.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed predisposed to knocking over glasses of water with its tail.
meanings.sent4: Her cheerful nature made her predisposed to spreading positivity wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The old house was predisposed to creaking in the wind, adding to its eerie charm.

meanings.definition: Having a tendency or inclination towards something
meanings.sent1: The athlete was predisposed to excelling in sports from a young age.
meanings.sent2: She is predisposed to feeling anxious in crowded places.
meanings.sent3: The plant seemed predisposed to growing towards the sunlight, reaching for its warmth.
meanings.sent4: His adventurous spirit made him predisposed to seeking out new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The old clock was predisposed to chiming at odd hours, surprising everyone in the house.
